source: Public Industry Trends – Business Insider & fullscale.io
trends: Google Staff Engineer compensation and career growth without PhD
Common software engineer title hierarchy and specialization

level_1: Industry news shows engineers can reach high-paying roles through performance.
level_2: Articles explain career titles like SDE I, II, Senior, Principal and their pay ranges.
level_3: Reports show that competitive coding and research internships help career growth.
level_4: Trends include reading research papers regularly, contributing to emerging fields like AI.

level_1: Story of engineer from IIT reaching Google Staff (L6)
level_2: Hierarchy of roles shows growth path from junior to principal
level_3: Engineers using reading groups to stay updated
level_4: Senior staff leading paper reviews and pushing AI initiatives

level_1: Entry SDE I roles for fresh grads
level_2: SDE II roles for coding efficiency and project ownership
level_3: Senior staff lead system design and cross-team initiatives
level_4: Staff engineer leads AI product strategy and mentorship

level_1: Ask: Where do I start in the software career ladder?
level_2: Ask: How can I move to the next level with projects or study?
level_3: Think: Which industry trend should I follow (AI, cloud)?
level_4: Reflect: How can I contribute to company strategy and innovation?

level_1: Not knowing what titles mean or require
level_3: Not staying current with industry trends

level_2: What defines promotion to Senior engineer?
level_3: Why read research papers as an engineer?
level_4: How can engineers build strategic influence?

level_1: Research and list role titles and levels in top tech companies
level_2: Track salary and path info for SDE II to Senior roles
level_3: Join a reading group or start one on research papers
level_4: Pitch an innovation idea linking your role to industry trends

level_1: Don't assume all roles are the same across companies
level_2: Avoid ignoring title and role differences
level_3: Don't skip continuous learning like paper reviews
level_4: Avoid working only on code—focus on business impact
